channel.title: The Class X Podcast
channel.description: Two curious social science teachers analyze books, articles, documentaries, shows, and cultural issues from an independent perspective.
channel.author: Shukri Rashid
channel.itunes:author: Shukri Rashid
channel.itunes:summary: Two curious social science teachers analyze books, articles, documentaries, shows, and cultural issues from an independent perspective.

item.title: Draymond Green and the Culture of Winning
item.description:
Shukri discusses the recent Draymond Green controversy, along with the idea of what it means to have a winning culture. Does it mean that the winners are morally superior? Does it mean that they are noble? Shukri will explore these ideas on this episode of The Class X Podcast.

--- Send in a voice message: https://anchor.fm/classxpodcast/message
item.dc:creator: Shukri Rashid

--- Send in a voice message: https://anchor.fm/classxpodcast/message

item.title: Adapting Books to Film
item.description:
Shukri compares House of the Dragon to the source material for the show, Fire and Blood, and asks the question: What is the proper relationship between source material and the film version of books?

--- Send in a voice message: https://anchor.fm/classxpodcast/message

item.title: How Sega Challenged the Gaming World
item.description:
Shukri reviews the Netflix series, High Score, and discusses the rise of Sega. How did Sega challenge Nintendo? How are Sonic and Madden Football related? This podcast will explain the connections.

--- Send in a voice message: https://anchor.fm/classxpodcast/message

item.title: Do People Change Over Time?
item.description:
Shukri reflects on an article from The New Yorker titled: Are You The Same Person You Used To Be? By Joshua Rothman. This podcast reflects on continuity and change within the individual's life. How are you the same? How have you changed? Hopefully, this episode will get you to reflect on that question. 

--- Send in a voice message: https://anchor.fm/classxpodcast/message
item.dc:creator: Shukri Rashid
item.itunes:summary:
Shukri reflects on an article from The New Yorker titled: Are You The Same Person You Used To Be? By Joshua Rothman. This podcast reflects on continuity and change within the individual's life. How are you the same? How have you changed? Hopefully, this episode will get you to reflect on that question. 

--- Send in a voice message: https://anchor.fm/classxpodcast/message

item.title: Two Xennials Discuss Reality Bites
item.description:
John and Shukri discuss the ultimate Generation X movie: Reality Bites. Is this film specifically focused on Gen X problems or do young people face the same issues today? John and Shukri discuss this famous Generation X movie on The Class X Podcast.  

--- Send in a voice message: https://anchor.fm/classxpodcast/message

item.title: The Fighting Spirit
item.description:
Shukri reviews the sports anime, Hajime no Ippo (The Fighting Spirit). This anime series has stood the test of time, with an emphasis on grit, perseverance, and industry. If you like inspirational stories, this is the show for you. 

--- Send in a voice message: https://anchor.fm/classxpodcast/message

item.title: John Adams: Independent, Passionate, and Committed
item.description:
Shukri reflects on the life of John Adams. Adams is one of the most independent voices in American history, and The Class X Podcast reflects on that through an examination of the HBO show, John Adams, and through Joseph Ellis' book, Passionate Sage.

--- Send in a voice message: https://anchor.fm/classxpodcast/message
item.dc:creator: Shukri Rashid
item.itunes:summary:
Shukri reflects on the life of John Adams. Adams is one of the most independent voices in American history, and The Class X Podcast reflects on that through an examination of the HBO show, John Adams, and through Joseph Ellis' book, Passionate Sage.

--- Send in a voice message: https://anchor.fm/classxpodcast/message

item.title: The Cultural Impact of CM Punk
item.description:
Shukri discusses the legacy of CM Punk. Punk is an example of an individual who connected with a sub group. This podcast looks at that subgroup and examines the phenomenon of connecting with characters who appeal to our experiences.

--- Send in a voice message: https://anchor.fm/classxpodcast/message

item.title: A Teacher and Student Reflect on the Teaching of History
item.description:
Shukri and Jake analyze the controversy surrounding the teaching of American history. What is actually taught in the classroom? Is it controversial? Is history too political? The Class X Podcast takes a look at this issue from the perspective of a history teacher and a student of history.

--- Send in a voice message: https://anchor.fm/classxpodcast/message
item.dc:creator: Shukri Rashid
item.itunes:summary:

--- Send in a voice message: https://anchor.fm/classxpodcast/message

item.title: Why Am I Losing Interest in Game of Thrones?
item.description:
Shukri reflects on the prequel to Game of Thrones and asks the question: Do we experience a change in taste as we age? If you do or you don't, this episode may get you to reflect on the evolution of your taste in the arts.

--- Send in a voice message: https://anchor.fm/classxpodcast/message

item.title: Grantchester: A Story of Two Shows
item.description:
Shukri discusses the evolution of the show: Grantchester. How does a show stay relevant after the main character leaves? Grantchester not only stays relevant, but it gets better over time. Shukri will discuss the constantly changing story of Grantchester on this episode of The Class X Podcast.

--- Send in a voice message: https://anchor.fm/classxpodcast/message
item.dc:creator: Shukri Rashid
item.itunes:summary:

item.title: How Steve Nash and the Phoenix Suns Changed Basketball
item.description:
Shukri reviews the book: Seven Seconds or Less: My Season on the Bench with the Runnin' and Gunnin' Phoenix Suns by Jack McCallum. This book is an insider's view of a team that changed professional basketball. You will hear about people like Steve Nash, Mike D'Antoni, and Amar'e Stoudemire on this podcast. Plus, you will get Shukri's memories of this fun, energetic Phoenix Suns team. 

Thanks for listening to The Class X Podcast.

--- Send in a voice message: https://anchor.fm/classxpodcast/message
item.dc:creator: Shukri Rashid
item.itunes:summary:
Shukri reviews the book: Seven Seconds or Less: My Season on the Bench with the Runnin' and Gunnin' Phoenix Suns by Jack McCallum. Plus, you will get Shukri's memories of this fun, energetic Phoenix Suns team. 

Thanks for listening to The Class X Podcast.

item.title: Try Harder: College Admissions, Competition, and Self-Worth
item.description:
Shukri and Jake discuss the documentary: Try Harder. Are we in a hypercompetitive age that prioritizes elite colleges over realistic goals? Should your choice of college define who you are as a person? These questions and more are discussed on this episode of The Class X Podcast. 

--- Send in a voice message: https://anchor.fm/classxpodcast/message
item.dc:creator: Shukri Rashid
item.itunes:summary:

--- Send in a voice message: https://anchor.fm/classxpodcast/message

item.title: Remote Work: Is It Here to Stay?
item.description:
John and Shukri discuss how Americans are experiencing remote work in 2022. Should we all go back to the workplace? Is remote work here to stay? Or, is this a non-issue? The Class X guys look at these questions and more on this episode of The Class X Podcast. 

--- Send in a voice message: https://anchor.fm/classxpodcast/message

item.description:
Is it fair to compare athletes from different generations? Do you think one generation is superior to another? Shukri reflects on these questions and more on this episode of The Class X Podcast.

item.title: The Wire: Great Show or Greatest Show?
item.description:
Shukri and John discuss the legacy of The Wire. Was it great or was it the greatest show of all time? That question is discussed and The Class X guys try to figure out if the message of The Wire was as clear as contemporary analysts assume. If you enjoyed The Wire or love television analysis, check out this episode of The Class X Podcast. 

--- Send in a voice message: https://anchor.fm/classxpodcast/message

item.itunes:summary:

--- Send in a voice message: https://anchor.fm/classxpodcast/message

item.title: Inspector Morse
item.description:
Shukri discusses one of his favorite shows: Inspector Morse. Morse is the prequel to the Endeavor series, so if you have seen Endeavor, you will get background information on the original series. Morse is incredibly popular around the world. Why is that? Shukri will look at that question, along with others, on this episode of The Class X Podcast. 

--- Send in a voice message: https://anchor.fm/classxpodcast/message

item.title: Saudi Arabia and the Future of Golf
item.description:
Shukri and John analyze the new, controversial golf league, which is funded by Saudi Arabia, and discuss some big questions. Is golf going to change forever? Is the western media hypocritical? Is the PGA afraid of globalization? These questions and many more are discussed, and the Class X guys analyze an NY Times article called: This Is Uncomfortable: Saudi Arabia Upends Genteel World Of Pro Golf". 

--- Send in a voice message: https://anchor.fm/classxpodcast/message

item.title: The Beginning and End of Decades and Distinct Culture
item.description:
Shukri focuses on two questions: 1) When did the 1990's begin? 2) Are the early 2000's and 2010's distinct? If you have your own opinions, email us at theclassxpodcast@gmail.com.

item.title: The Psychology of Happiness: Science or Trend?
item.description:
John and Shukri discuss the psychological study of happiness. From gratitude journals to meditation, the psychology of happiness hopes to provide answers to difficult questions, but the question remains:  Is it a trend, or is it legitimate science?

item.title: Woodstock 99-Why Such Chaos?
item.description:
Shukri and John analyze the infamous, Woodstock 99 music festival. They look at the HBO documentary, Woodstock 99, and try to figure out why the event turned violent. Give us your thoughts at theclassxpodcast@gmail.com.

--- Send in a voice message: https://anchor.fm/classxpodcast/message

item.title: Amy Chua-Tiger Mom Controversy
item.description:
Shukri takes a look at the most recent controversy involving the "Tiger Mom" Amy Chua. The big question that comes up is: who is a public intellectual and who is a professional provocateur? Enjoy the episode and please subscribe!
